markdownRemark.html:
Understand the version correspondence between choerodon-ui hzero-front and UED to better apply themes and solve style puzzles.

Theme Design Manual

Refer to Open Platform Design CenterDesign Specification Manual

UED Version Introduction

UED information and support is described in the Open platform, please click UED Introduction

UED is short for Component Library Theme Dependency Package, and four major versions have been produced in the iterative optimization of the scheme, namely 2.0.x 3.1.x 4.1.x and 5.1.x.

Among them, 4.1.x and 5.1.x are the latest versions at present. 4.1.x applies to the component library LESS variable scheme scenario (the default scheme). 5.1.x applies to the component library CSS variable scheme. Some additional configuration is required in the project to display properly. The following is the upgrade guide for 5.1.x.

The corresponding application versions in the Hzero framework are respective

hzero-front UED
<=1.6.x 2.0.x
1.7.x 3.1.x
>=1.8.x 4.1.x / 5.1.x

Topic support by version:

  • 5.1.x is applied to the C7N-UI CSS variable scenario. Supports four themes: iceflow (iceflow), peacock (peacock), aurora (aurora) and nightingale (nightingale);
  • 4.1.x is applied to the C7N-UI LESS variable scenario. Supports five themes: iceflow (iceflow), peacock (peacock), aurora (aurora), campanula (theme4) and nightingale (nightingale);
  • 4.0.x (Upgrade to 4.1.x) is applied to the C7N-UI LESS variable scenario. Supports five themes: iceflow (iceflow), aurora (aurora), campanula (theme4) and nightingale (nightingale);
  • 3.1.x is applied to the C7N-UI LESS variable scenario. Supports three themes: iceflow (theme1), aurora (theme3) and campanula (theme4);
  • 2.0.x is applied to the C7N-UI LESS variable scenario. Supports: Two themes: iceflow (theme1) and aurora (theme3).

Before 4.1.x, the peacock (theme2) theme does not exist in the UED theme dependency package, it exists in the hzero-front dependency package as the basic style in the Hzero framework, so its related problems are handled by upgrading the hzero-front or global style override.

UED 5.1.x Upgrade guide

UED upgrade logs

UED update logs are periodically modified on open platforms. You can query the updated content of the corresponding version by linking to: UED upgrade logs

FAQ

  1. The difference between the choerodon-ui and UED versions results in a styling issue that can easily arise when one of the choerodon-ui UED hzero-front is unilaterally updated. Because choerodon-ui has a certain correspondence with the UED version, there will be differences when the gap between the two versions is large, which leads to problems. Most of these problems can be solved by fixing UED to a stable version corresponding to choerodon-ui or by updating both to the latest version. For example, the style problem of form misalignment when updating choerodon-ui to 1.5.2 and above #solutionã€‚
  2. Only the theme2 has a styling problem. Such problems are mainly caused by the lower hzero-front version and the higher choerodon-ui version. This can be resolved by upgrading hzero-front or global style overrides. Upgrading the hzero-front is recommended here. Because global style overrides can affect styles in other themes, consider whether there are any negative effects when you do style overrides. For example, the form must be entered style problem after the earlier version of hzero-front was upgraded to choerodon-ui #solution.
  3. How to locate the problem ? Problem location process. If you have other questions, please give us feedback in time.
